headers.access-control-expose-headers: ETag, Link, Location, Retry-After, X-GitHub-OTP, X-RateLimit-Limit, X-RateLimit-Remaining, X-RateLimit-Used, X-RateLimit-Resource, X-RateLimit-Reset, X-OAuth-Scopes, X-Accepted-OAuth-Scopes, X-Poll-Interval, X-GitHub-Media-Type, X-GitHub-SSO, X-GitHub-Request-Id, Deprecation, Sunset

nodes.body:
@varunursekar I’m not sure whether this is a bug or expected behavior, but currently if the caller times out, the SDK won’t cancel streaming immediately. It “safely” waits for any background task to finish (see `_await_task_safely` function).

If you need streaming timeouts today, the best approach seems to be implementing your own timer and call `result.cancel()` directly. It supports "immediate" and "after_turn". See: https://github.com/openai/openai-agents-python/pull/1896  and https://github.com/openai/openai-agents-python/issues/1895

This use case was not supported by design, but enabling to use the timeout this way may be useful for other developers too. My pull request https://github.com/openai/openai-agents-python/pull/2226 may resolve it. Feedback is welcome!
